target.name: BridgeHead
target.text: To Add IP Addresses to a SUSE Enterprise Server:

target.name: Procedure
target.text: Open YaST Administrator Settings, select Network Devices, and then select Network Card.

target.name: Step
target.text: Open YaST Administrator Settings, select Network Devices, and then select Network Card.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Next, select the desired network interface and click Edit.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Advanced, and select Additional Addresses from the drop-down list.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Add and enter the IP addresses and netmasks appropriate for your network.

target.name: Sect1
target.text: Installing the Conferencing Server

target.name: BridgeHead
target.text: Running the Installer on SLES:

target.name: Procedure
target.text: Unpack the distribution compressed tar archive (sitescape-conferencing-<version>.tar.gz):

target.name: Step
target.text: Unpack the distribution compressed tar archive (sitescape-conferencing-<version>.tar.gz):

target.name: Step
target.text: Copy the license key to the sitescape-conferencing directory that contains install.sh (the directory files exist after you unpack the compressed tar archive):

target.name: Step
target.text: Change directories to the sitescape-conferencing directory that contains install.sh:

target.name: Step
target.text: If you plan on running Active Directory LDAP Synchronization, you need to edit the ldap.xml.in file in the cluster-prototype directory (see Appendix E, "LDAP User Authentication," on page 47):

target.name: SubSteps
target.text: Open the ldap.xml.in file.

target.name: Step
target.text: Open the ldap.xml.in file.

target.name: Step
target.text: Comment out the eDirectory attributes section and uncomment out the ActiveDirectory attributes section.

target.name: Step
target.text: Save the file.

target.name: Step
target.text: Run the installer:

target.name: Step
target.text: The installer prompts you to accept the license (the default is N), enter Y:

target.name: Step
target.text: The installer prompts you to proceed, enter Y:

target.name: Step
target.text: The installer prompts you to select whether this is a new install or an upgrade (the default is N), enter Y to run a new installation:

target.name: Step
target.text: The installer prompts you to enter a name for the install (the default is ourzon), enter the name you want to use for the install:

target.name: Step
target.text: The installer prompts you to initialize the database for a new install (the default is Y), you must enter Y here for a new installation or the database service does not start:

target.name: Step
target.text: The installer prompts you to enter a password for the administrator user (this should be set for security reasons since the Administrator account needs to be a controlled environment):

target.name: Step
target.text: The installer prompts you whether to enable SSL/TLS security (the default is Y):

target.name: Step
target.text: The installer prompts you to enter the path and name of the certificate for the XML router (the default is /opt/iic/conf/server.pem), enter the default certificate:

target.name: Step
target.text: The installer prompts you to enter the path and name of the certificate for the Web Server.

target.name: Step
target.text: The installer prompts you to identify whether you are installing on a Single-Host or a Multiple-Host installation (the default is Y), if you have multiple servers then select N and the installer will prompt you to enter the additional information for a Multiple-Host installation:

target.name: Step
target.text: The installer prompts you to enter the IP address for thew XML router:

target.name: Step
target.text: The installer prompts you to enter the hostname of the conferencing server:

target.name: Step
target.text: The installer prompts you to enter the IP address for the Web Portal:

target.name: Step
target.text: The installer prompts you to enter the portal name:

target.name: Step
target.text: The installer prompts you to enter the IP address for the App-Share:

target.name: Step
target.text: The installer prompts you to enter the Hostname for the desktop App-Share:

target.name: Step
target.text: The installer prompts you to select whether you are running Conferencing Bridge (the default is N), if you enter Y, the installer will prompt you to enter the bridge information:

target.name: Step
target.text: The installer prompts you to select whether you want to change the system administration e-mail configuration (the default is N), if you enter Y, the installer will prompt you to enter the new e-mail address configuration information instead of using default configuration:

target.name: Step
target.text: The installer prompts you to verify what you have entered up to this point (enter Y if the information is correct or enter N if you need to make any changes):

target.name: Step
target.text: The installer prompts you to select whether you want to change the mailer configuration:

target.name: Step
target.text: The installer prompts you to select whether you want to change the database backup configuration:

target.name: Step
target.text: The installer prompts you to select whether you want to change the meeting archive maintenance configuration:

target.name: Step
target.text: The installer prompts you to select whether you want to change the document share repository maintenance configuration:

target.name: Step
target.text: The installer prompts you to select whether you want to change the audit logs:

target.name: Step
target.text: The installer prompts you to select whether you want to change the logging configuration:

target.name: Step
target.text: The installer prompts you to select whether you want to change the real-time call user-reservations logs:

target.name: Step
target.text: The installer prompts you to select whether you want to change the security configuration:

target.name: Step
target.text: The installer prompts you to select whether you want to change the LDAP configuration:

target.name: Step
target.text: The installer prompts you to select whether you want to change the system e-mail header configuration:

target.name: Step
target.text: The installer prompts you to select whether you want to change the e-mail template:

target.name: Step
target.text: The installer prompts you to select whether you want to change the meeting invitation template:

target.name: Step
target.text: The installer prompts you to select whether you want to change the summary e-mail template:

target.name: Step
target.text: The installer prompts you to select whether you want to change the meeting archive e-mail template:

target.name: Step
target.text: The installer lists all the services running on the local host, hit the ENTER/RETURN key to continue:

target.name: Step
target.text: The installer lists all the configuration information, hit the ENTER/RETURN key to continue:

target.name: Step
target.text: The installer prompts you to select whether you are satisfied with the configuration (the default is Y), enter N to change the configuration:

target.name: Step
target.text: The installation begins and uses whatever values you entered during the installation setup.

target.name: Step
target.text: The installation completes and displays information stating the services that should be running.

target.name: BridgeHead
target.text: Initial Address Book Configuration (Synchronization)

target.name: Sect1
target.text: Review the Conferencing Cluster Components Installation Process

target.name: Sect2
target.text: Initial Installation

target.name: Procedure
target.text: Create and name a new Conferencing installation.

target.name: Step
target.text: Create and name a new Conferencing installation.

target.name: Step
target.text: Initialize the PostgreSQL database.

target.name: Step
target.text: Identify a Single-Host or a Multiple-Host installation.

target.name: Step
target.text: Provide the IPs and the hostnames for the XML Router, Web Portal and Desktop/App Server.

target.name: Step
target.text: Install a Conferencing Voice Bridge (optional).

target.name: Sect2
target.text: System Administration E-mail Configuration (Optional)

target.name: Sect2
target.text: Configuring LDAP Synchronization (Optional)

target.name: Procedure
target.text: Type y, then press Enter.

target.name: Step
target.text: Type y, then press Enter.

target.name: Step
target.text: Type y, then press Enter.

target.name: Step
target.text: Type e for Edit to define your first LDAP server, then press Enter.

target.name: Step
target.text: Type 1 for the server number, then press Enter.

target.name: Step
target.text: Specify the URL in the following format, then press Enter.

target.name: Step
target.text: Specify the Admin-equivalent username with full context, then press Enter.

target.name: Step
target.text: Type the password for the Admin-equivalent user, then press Enter.

target.name: Step
target.text: Specify the eDirectory/ActiveDirectory container that defines the search scope, then press Enter.

target.name: Step
target.text: Press Enter to accept the default value.

target.name: Step
target.text: Press Enter to accept the default value.

target.name: Step
target.text: Press Enter to accept the default value.

target.name: Step
target.text: To add more LDAP servers to the list, type a for Add, press Enter, then repeat Step 4 through Step 11, adjusting the information as needed for each LDAP server.

target.name: Step
target.text: If you make a mistake and need to remove an LDAP server from the list, type d for Delete, press Enter, type the number of the server to delete, then press Enter, type y to confirm, then press Enter again.

target.name: Step
target.text: When you are finished listing LDAP servers, type q for Quit, then press Enter.

target.name: Step
target.text: Continue as usual with the Conferencing installation.

target.name: Sect2
target.text: Building the Conferencing Client RPM

target.name: Procedure
target.text: Untar the Conferencing client package from root directory:

target.name: Step
target.text: Untar the Conferencing client package from root directory:

target.name: Step
target.text: Build the Conferencing Client Install RPM (specify yes or no for the "use-ssl" parameter below):

target.name: Step
target.text: If generated on the Conferencing server, the RPM is automatically copied to the web download directory. Otherwise, copy the generated RPM manually to the Conferencing server:

target.name: Sect2
target.text: Installing the Conferencing Client

target.name: Procedure
target.text: After installing the Conferencing server, you can download the Conferencing client from the following URLs:

target.name: Step
target.text: After installing the Conferencing server, you can download the Conferencing client from the following URLs:

target.name: Step
target.text: Select Open or Run to invoke the installer after the download completes.

target.name: Sect2
target.text: Installing the Pidgin Instant Chat Client

target.name: Procedure
target.text: Download the pidgin.exe (Windows) or pidgin.rpm (Linux) executable file to your desktop.

target.name: Step
target.text: Download the pidgin.exe (Windows) or pidgin.rpm (Linux) executable file to your desktop.

target.name: Step
target.text: In Linux and Windows, double-click the pidgin (.rpm or .exe) installer (placed on the desktop during download), or select Open or Run to invoke the installer.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the Installer Language dialog that appears, select your language from the drop-down list.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Finish to complete the installation process.
